New Records: Ross Adair hit his third T20I century, following Kevin O'Brien and Paul Stirling, who also scored 52 from 31 balls with seven fours and a six. Ireland achieved their first T20I victory over South Africa.
Key Match Events: Ross Adair was reprieved on 19 when he top-edged a pull to square leg off Bjorn Fortuin, who was over-ruled by the third umpire. Ireland's all-round performance was magnificent, with Mark Adair and Graeme Hume delivering outstanding bowling performances.
Post-Match Reflections: Ireland's victory was a pivotal moment in their journey, and the team showed resilience and skill in overcoming South Africa's batting collapse.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the second T20I match between Ireland and South Africa, with South Africa previously winning the first match by eight wickets. Ireland's win levelled the series.
